intro: Delostoma weberbauerianum, commonly known as the Weberbauer's blister beetle, is a species of plant in the family Mecantheriaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
